section.name: How to install the embargo plugin

subsection.name: Prerequisites
subsection.p: These instruction assumes that you have an HST project based on the HST archetype, i.e. a Maven multiproject consisting of at least three submodules: cms, site and content.

subsection.name: Maven 2 repository
subsection.p: Add this repository to your root pom.xml (if it has not already been defined in a parent pom):

li.p: Add this dependency to the dependency management section of your root pom.xml:
Add this dependency to the pom.xml of your cms module:
Add this dependency to the pom.xml of your site module:
Add the following xml declaration (under any filename) to your site module, under META-INF/hst-assembly/overrides:
li.source:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-3.0.xsd">
<import resource="classpath:/org/hippoecm/hst/site/container/SpringComponentManager-jcr.xml"/>
<bean class="org.onehippo.forge.embargo.hst.addons.SessionRefreshEventListener" id="sessionRefreshEventListener"> <property name="repository" ref="javax.jcr.Repository"/> <property name="credentials" ref="javax.jcr.Credentials.default"/> </bean>
<bean id="customJcrObservationEventListenerItems" class="org.springframework.beans.factory.config.ListFactoryBean"> <property name="sourceList"> <list> <bean class="org.hippoecm.hst.core.jcr.EventListenerItemImpl"> <property name="nodeAddedEnabled" value="false"/> <property name="nodeRemovedEnabled" value="false"/> <property name="propertyAddedEnabled" value="true"/> <property name="propertyChangedEnabled" value="true"/> <property name="propertyRemovedEnabled" value="true"/> <property name="nodeTypeNames" value="embargo:embargo"/> <property name="absolutePath" value="/content"/> <property name="deep" value="true"/> <property name="eventListener"> <ref bean="sessionRefreshEventListener"/> </property> </bean> </list> </property> </bean>
</beans>

li.p: Rebuild your project. After startup, you should have the embargo workflow and an example embargo-enabled usergroup.
